newsitem.title: USA: Continental American, Country Wide merging.
newsitem.headline: Continental American, Country Wide merging.

text.p: Continental American Transportation Inc and Country Wide Transport Services Inc said Friday they've signed a letter of intent to merge.
The companies said they will exchange five shares of Country Wide common stock for one share of Continental American.
The combined company expects to have annual revenues of about $140 million and a trucking fleet of 950 tractors and close to 1,600 trailers, the companies said.
The merger is subject to a definitive agreement and the approval of Country Wide's board and stockholders, the companies said.
They said Continental American will become the parent company upon completion of the merger and will operate Country Wide services as subsidiaries.

Continental American is based in Calhoun, Ga., and owns subsidiaries that operate in 48 states. Country Wide is based in Corona, Calif., and delivers commodities throughout the United States and Canada.
